Description: Scarab carved from steatite; back detailed with crudely incised lines for clypeus, head, prothorax, elytra and winglets; underside bearing incised hieroglyphic inscription arranged vertically, framed by incised line; pierced lengthwise.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (OA.90) (phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Egyptian Museum, Cairo
